cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 105 mi SSE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northwest toward the South/North Carolina coast, then forecast to curve northward and move up the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic late Sunday into Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina–South Carolina border just north of Myrtle Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of SC and NC first, then VA–MD–DE shores as the cyclone lifts northward
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy with gusts 25–35 mph possible late Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Delaware River/Bay; minor tidal departures under 1 ft possible
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Monday into early Tuesday with locally higher pockets
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated surf along Delaware and New Jersey beaches beginning late weekend
